page.title: 15The Elderly In Milnathort
page.content: The 1981 Census shows 273 people (92 men & 181 women) over{retiring age, forming 25% of the population.A sample of 45 were interviewed to find why they lived here.32% are natives,30% married a local person,11% had worked here,11% have relatives here,8% retired to here and 8% had other reasons.Only 1 person did not like Milnathort. 70% of{pensioners}do their main {shopping}in Milnathort,even though it is a small village.46% of them also go to Kinross,where the choice is also small and prices are higher than in Perth.Their means of{travel}are:-19% are given a lift by car;14% go by service bus;8% go by own car;5% go by Kinross Day Centre minibus.68% of them also shop elsewhere,mainly in Perth and Dunfermline.
